ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 492
ygData.msgSnippet: I totally aggree with you on www.everquest.allakazam.com being the best website. If you really really need good info pay the membership fee. it s only
ygData.messageBody:
I totally aggree with you on www.everquest.allakazam.com being the best
website. If you really really need good info pay the membership fee. it's
only something like $3 a month and gives you total access. It's the best
site around for equipment, quest and item info. www.eqatlas.com is the best
for maps. I've printed out every single one and it's come in handy on more
than one occasion. www.everlore.com is pretty good but I still prefer
allakazam
Nepeta- 54 druid - Veeshan server
New alts-
Mirya - 13 chanter
Felynne- 11 shaman


----- Original Message -----
From: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 27, 2002 2:20 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Digest Number 492


>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com

> Message: 1
> Date: Sun, 26 May 2002 15:42:54 -0000
> From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
> Subject: Re: New to Online Gaming
>
> To clarify that a bit, the lag meter monitors the condition of your
> connection. I don't really know what the various numbers mean, but as
> your bar goes red and shrinks, you may expect to be disconnected.
> This may be at the game server or your internet connection. When you
> are disconnected you go "link dead." Inconvenient most of the time,
> deadly if you are in battle.
>
> If you are in a critical situation and your bar keeps going red then
> back to green, it is often wise to move somewhere safe until the lag
> problem goes away. The better your system the less lag you get on
> your end, but there are still connection and server issues which will
> give you some lag. Another aspect of the game to learn, Lag
> Management.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "The Mad Macinchaote" <scendera@v...> wrote:
> > That's the lagmeter.
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: quiller64
> > To: EverQuest@y...
> > Sent: Sunday, May 26, 2002 1:27 AM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] New to Online Gaming
> >
> >

> > 1. In the game on the main screen on the middle right is a green
> bar
> > with a number , a percentage, another percentage, and a second
> number
> > (always changing), what is it? I couldn't find in the manual.
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Sun, 26 May 2002 12:20:44 -0400
> From: "Jenn" <juniper.jot@...>
> Subject: Re: Digest Number 491
>
> Glossary I've found http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqglossary.htm
>
> Also check out eqtraders.com and lokari.net for tradeskill info. May not
wanna get into the more expensive tradeskills but I made my armor at level 5
and wore it up until near 20 when I could finally trade up for better.
>
> Umm what else? Oh yeah, everquest.allakhazam.com, best quest info. Some
people swear by everlore.com but I've not found that as useful.
> And eq.castersrealm.com even if you aren't a caster. Check it out, there
is info on all classes and they have forums for you to check out.
> Oops almost forgot, you need maps too, I guess. www.eqatlas.com, you can
link to that one from allakhazam if you forget the url.
> Heard there is going to be a wirebound book coming out with all the maps
but I don't know when and eqatlas will get you thru for now.

> From: "quiller64" <jflip64@...>
> Subject: New to Online Gaming
>
> Thanks to all that replied to my original message. Bought the
> trilogy, started this afternoon, 9 hours later I can see why its
> called Evercrack. Started a wood elf ranger.
> 2 questions:
> 1. In the game on the main screen on the middle right is a green bar
> with a number , a percentage, another percentage, and a second number
> (always changing), what is it? I couldn't find in the manual.
>
> 2. Can anyone recommend a site/guide that has a good EQ lingo
> glossary.
>
> Thanks again
